intro: Jouyella, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a perennial plant belonging to the family Araceae. It is characterized by its dark green, waxy leaves that are often heart-shaped or lanceolate in form. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Due to its toxic sap and foliage, it is important to handle the plant with care.
